type.name: section
type.title: Investment of special funds and exemption of trustee from payment of income tax.
type.context: SUGAR INDUSTRY SPECIAL FUNDS ACT under Investment of special funds and exemption of trustee from payment of income tax. 4.  (1) The Secretary to the Treasury may, with the approval of the Minister, invest or place on deposit account any of the moneys of any of the special funds specified in section 2, and any interest earned on moneys so invested or deposited shall be placed to the credit of the appropriate special fund.  (2) The Secretary to the Treasury, in his capacity as trustee of the special funds specified in section 2, is exempt from the payment of income tax under the Income Tax Act.

type.title: Allocation to special funds of amounts paid under section
type.context: SUGAR INDUSTRY SPECIAL FUNDS ACT under Allocation to special funds of amounts paid under section 6. The Comptroller of Customs shall pay to the Secretary to the Treasury the amounts paid to him under section 5, and the Secretary to the Treasury, subject to section 7, shall allocate such amounts to the credit of  the special funds specified in section 2 in the proportions hereinafter set out, that is to say   (a)  to  the  Sugar  Industry  Price   Stabilisation  Fund,  a proportion equivalent to two dollars and fifty cents on every ton of sugar manufactured and exported;  (b)   to the Sugar Industry Rehabilitation Fund, a proportion equivalent  to  twelve  dollars  on  every  ton  of  sugar manufactured and exported; and  (c)   to the Sugar Industry Labour Welfare Fund, a proportion equivalent to five hundred dollars on every ton of sugar manufactured and exported:  Provided that from the amounts allocated pursuant to paragraphs (a) and (b) there shall be paid by the Secretary to the Treasury into the Cane Farmers Price  Stabilisation  Fund  and  the  Cane  Farmers Rehabilitation  Fund respectively established by the Cane Farmers Special Funds Act sums equivalent in the aggregate to the sums allowed as deductions in respect of the Sugar Industry Price Stabilisation Fund and  the   Sugar  Industry  Rehabilitation  Fund  respectively  when computing the price to be paid by a LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 69:03 Sugar Industry Special Funds    L.R.O. 1/2012  c. 69:04 Subsidiary legislation. type.name: section
type.title: Power of Minister to vary rates and proportions under sections  5 and 6, and to order a cessation of payments under section
type.context: SUGAR INDUSTRY SPECIAL FUNDS ACT under Power of Minister to vary rates and proportions under sections  5 and 6, and to order a cessation of payments under section 7.  (1) The Minister may by order (a)      at any time and from time to time vary the rate specified in section 5(1);  (b)      at any time and from time to time vary the proportions set out in section 6;  (c)    prescribe that the amount specified in section 5 shall cease  to be levied, collected and paid in respect of sugar exported on or after a date specified in the order.  (2) Where an order is made under subsection (1)(a) or (b), the rate as varied or the proportions as varied shall have effect as if the varied rate or the varied proportions were specified or set out in section 5(1), or in section 6, as the case may be.  (3) Where an order is made under subsection (1)(c), the power of  the Secretary to the Treasury under section 5(3) to recover any amount payable under that section but not paid before the date specified in the order shall continue to have effect in the same manner and to the same extent as if the order had not been made.

type.name: section
type.title: Powers of the Committee with regard to claims.
type.context: SUGAR INDUSTRY SPECIAL FUNDS ACT under Powers of the Committee with regard to claims. 18. (1) Any registered exporter may claim to be reimbursed from the Fund for any work of rehabilitation carried out by him, or to be advanced any sum of money to defray the cost of any work of rehabilitation contemplated by him.  (2) Any registered exporter making any claims as aforesaid shall declare in writing to the Committee    (a) the amount claimed;  (b) the nature of the work of rehabilitation already carried out or in process of being carried out or contemplated; and  (c) the actual or estimated cost, as the case may be.  (3) Every claim for reimbursement shall be accompanied by a certified statement as to the amount expended, and that such sum was utilised solely on the work mentioned in the claim.  (4) Any registered exporter to whom payment of any sum of money from the Fund has been made under these Regulations, shall within six months of the date of the completion of the work of rehabilitation in respect of which such payment has been made, submit to the Committee a statement certified by an auditor or such other person as may LAWS OF GUYANA Sugar Industry Special Funds Cap. 69:03 15 [Subsidiary] Sugar Industry (Rehabilitation Fund) Regulations  L.R.O. 1/2012     Power of the Committee with regard to claims.  Power to enter and inspect factories in respect of which claims have been made.   Method of payment of disbursements and claims.                           be approved by the Committee, of the expenditure incurred in respect of such work of rehabilitation.
